summary: This bill, the Ensuring Community Access to Pharmacist Services Act, amends Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to cover pharmacist services under Medicare Part B. It defines "pharmacist services," specifying eligible services related to COVID-19, influenza, RSV, and strep throat, and those addressing public health emergencies. The bill outlines payment terms, including 80% reimbursement for services, and prohibits balance billing for pharmacist services. The amendments are slated to take effect January 1, 2026.
